content.description:
As with all Unaweep lines, if you know of a first ascent or party, please let me know, and I will update the info.

This line is a very long endurance problem about 20 moves long. Some cool intro climbing on weird slopers and fins leads to a large move to a really sick pinch. After this, you have to match on some incut crimps using a bicycle, then traverse straight right to some jugs and an obvious escape up a slab.

This thing has one big hold on the traverse I opted not to use, because I didn't want it to break off in my face. That being said, it could be totally solid. Either way, it does not really change the grade.
content.protection: I did it with 1 pad under the crux, but I'd guess 4 would make it safe.
content.location: Climb the lip of the overhang from left to right, then traverse the crimps across the overhang, and top out over another boulder on jugs.
